title: Just got a 14 day ban, and it was totally worth it! :)
body:
Played a game, had a bad game. Enemy team was BMing and bullying us/me for it. Tried to shake it off and play another game. Look and behold, the premade that won and were toxic was on my team this time. All through champ select they were bullying me on how they beat us good, gloating, saying no hard feelings, kept being toxic trying to tilt me for some reason even though I was on their team this time. 

I didn't respond in chat, but thought to myself: "I will get banned for this, but screw it, I'll take the 2 week break." I locked my champ in, went into the game, waited for the 3 minute mark and then said: "enjoy the loss, no hard feelings. :)" I left the game.

They lost, one was in their provisional, got silver 5 rank.

I got banned few hours later, so the system works. Lol. But it was worth it. I'll have my break (going on a vacation anyway for a few weeks) while knowing they were really pissed and got bad start ranking, they got punished for being bullies and toxic. (maybe even Riot punished them for it too).

Moral of the story: Don't be a douchebag, some of us don't care about getting punished, as long as you got the bad start ranking and lost the game that you wanted to win so badly. :)

Off to my vacation!

Cheers!

P.S. None of the teammates that lost were innocent as they were joining in on the bullying. Even if they were, I got the ban, I was punished.

replies.body:
The problem in this game is so many people put trolling teammates above winning.

Partially because the punishments are too light for both the offender and the offended who ends up toxic in the name of personal justice.

If punishments were harsher, the OP wouldn't feel the need to punish the bullies himself and he would be more wary of breaking the rules

Wow, good job man, you ruined the game for 2 completely random people because of what some other toxic players did!
Can you explain how what you did to the innocent bystanders is better than what these other toxic players did to you?

> P.S. None of the teammates that lost were innocent as they were joining in on the bullying. Even if they were, I got the ban, I was punished.

Reading comprehension is great.
Except that was added after I posted.
If you were smart you should have been quiet played the match and just baited them.  You probably could reported them and got them banned depending on how tilted they were.
Was this the first time? Seems like a harsh escalation to me.

>
> Was this the first time? Seems like a harsh escalation to me.

Nope. Same with inting when they catch you, you are deliberately ruining a game instead of pressing mute.

I know it's bad, I'm not defending it. But since they don't ban people the first time they are toxic in chat and instead only do something for people who show a consistent pattern of flaming/being toxic you'd think the same standards would apply to AFKing. 

The stricter the punishments overall the better it is so far as I'm concerned, but this seems like inconsistency to me if they actually hand out 14 day suspensions and put people on the brink of a permaban for the first offense of AFKing while being so lenient with toxic chat.

Leaver buster is different and has a different system. Deliberate game throwing is absolutely 'one or two strikes and you're out'.
